Hi,

Can you provide more information on how to reproduce the problem?

Hmm, after profiling the project at work I'm working on, this problem always
happen. I could not figure out how to avoid attaching the whole project source
tree for others to reproduce the problem, since it's big codebase and contains
proprietary code. If I attach the binary jar and profiling configurations (where
does this store in eclipse env?), will that help?

you can attach or send me your workspace with the jar file and i can try 
reproduce the bug from ur workspace.

Created an attachment (id=16055)
all files except dependent jar files

unzip the zip file, the .classpath, .project, and HyadesBug.launch are localted
under the root dir. The HyadesBug.launch should help for getting the same
profiling configuration as I have. After profiling the project, try to close
the "Profiling and Logging" perspective and choose "yes" in the "Profiling
Message" dialog box to save the profiled project info. Then one can get the
same error as I have in the .metadata/.log file. Pls get those dependent jar
files in lib.jar.txt. They are too big to include.
How do u handle the DB dependence?

David,
As you opened this bug in version 3.0.1. Can you please confirm me about Hyades 
setup and its dependency set?
I am assuming that you are using Hyades 3.0.1. then you have to set up correct 
dependency components with this as located(see Requirements section) at

http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/indextools.cgi/~checkout~/hyades-
home/downloads/drops/3.0.1_20040922_0955.html

This is release build of Hyades 3.0.1 and comes is these dependency set of 
*Eclipse SDK M20040917
*EMF SDK M200409161148
*XSD SDK M200409161148
I have reproduced this problem and investigating the causes.
Please retest with the JV arg -DACUROUTE_HOME=. instead of -DACUROUTE_HOME="."
